p: A. triphylla, C. citratus and L. cubeba EOs appeared to be the most active against A. fumigatus. These compounds would be of interest in poultry breeding, due to their low toxicity [ 27, 28, 29, 30]. Furthermore, data available on the long lasting persistence of C. citratus EO [ 31] would suggest its feasibility, when used as disinfectant.
